title: No children nodes listed when changing data source for a data set in the data set editor page of the query tab
description: There is a bug where no children nodes are being listed when changing the data source for a data set in the data set editor page of the query tab.
OB: When creating a new data set without an SQL statement and selecting a new data source that has no database/table/column information, no children nodes are listed in the data set editor page of the query tab. Additionally, after closing the data set editor and reopening it, the same issue persists.
EB: When creating a new data set without an SQL statement and selecting a new data source that has no database/table/column information, the children nodes should be listed in the data set editor page of the query tab.
SR:
To reproduce this issue, follow these steps:
1. Create a new data set without an SQL statement.
2. Select a new data source that has no database/table/column information.
3. Open the data set editor page in the query tab.
4. Notice that no children nodes are listed.
5. Close the data set editor and reopen it.
6. Observe that the issue persists with the children nodes not being listed.
